title: Why is Xin Zhao's heal more potent than Aatrox's?
body:
{{champion:266}} W, Blood Thirst/Blood Price:
While toggled off Aatrox benefits from Blood Thirst, while toggled on Blood Price is activated and removes Blood Thirst.
Blood Thirst: Every third attack, Aatrox restores 20/25/30/35/40 (+25% bonus Attack Damage) Health, increased by 200% when below half Health.
Blood Price: Every third attack, Aatrox deals 60/95/130/165/200 (+100% bonus Attack Damage) bonus physical damage and loses Health.


{{champion:5}} W, Battle Cry:
Passive: Xin Zhao heals himself for 30/35/40/45/50 (+70% Ability Power) every third basic attack.
Active: Xin Zhao unleashes a battle cry, increasing his Attack Speed by 40/50/60/70/80% for 5 seconds.


So, at all ranks, Xin Zhao's passive heal heals him for more than Aatrox. The only exception to this is the AD ratio, in which is only 25%, and only bonus AD, not base. His heal also works while using the active, and when its on cooldown, however Aatrox's only works when Blood Thirst is on, meaning he has to LOSE health to deal more damage, while Xin Zhao GAINS health.

Aatrox is based upon health regen in combat. Why does he have less ability regen than Xin? Aatrox even uses health, as Xin uses mana. How is this fair at all?
I say either buff Aatrox's heal, or remove Xin's.
